meanings.definition: Not characteristic of or appropriate for business.
meanings.sent1: Her casual attire was very unbusinesslike for the corporate meeting.
meanings.sent2: The professional attire of the employees was much more businesslike than her unbusinesslike outfit.
meanings.sent3: Despite her unbusinesslike appearance, she was surprisingly efficient in handling the project.
meanings.sent4: His unbusinesslike behavior stood out like a colorful painting in a room full of gray suits.
meanings.sent5: The unbusinesslike atmosphere of the startup company was refreshing compared to the rigid corporate environment.

meanings.definition: Lacking the qualities or characteristics of a business.
meanings.sent1: The amateurish website design was unbusinesslike and did not attract many customers.
meanings.sent2: The sleek and professional website design was a stark contrast to the unbusinesslike layout of their competitor.
meanings.sent3: The unbusinesslike approach to customer service left many clients feeling confused and frustrated.
meanings.sent4: Her unbusinesslike decision-making process was like trying to navigate through a maze blindfolded.
meanings.sent5: The unbusinesslike conduct of the new employee raised eyebrows among the more experienced staff members.
